Description: Evidence that goods have been shipped on board in good condition.
Allows multiple modes of transport across borders with different carriers.
Used for sea shipments; can be negotiable or non-negotiable.
Used for land transportation (truck or rail) to ports.
Confirms that goods have been received by the carrier, not necessarily shipped.
Indicates goods were damaged or quantity/quality issues noted (foul/dirty BOL).
Standard agreement between carrier and exporter with shipment terms.
Confirms goods were received in perfect condition by the carrier.
